author: _dawit
content: <@!430748255807078400> Thanks for the resources! Regarding using Eldarica: If I understand correctly, one would basically need to run the compiler with `settings.modelChecker.solvers=smtlib2` and provide a `smtSolver` callback that executes Eldarica (this callback will probably look very similar to the default one provided here https://github.com/ethereum/solc-js/blob/master/smtsolver.js). Would this be the way to do it?

author: leonardoalt
content: exactly!

author: leonardoalt
content: if you use this solc-js branch: https://github.com/ethereum/solc-js/tree/smt_proper_tests

author: leonardoalt
content:
https://gist.github.com/leonardoalt/0348b759856b7ce38fd8a98fa2ebff04
and run this script with node inside the solc-js dir

author: leonardoalt
content: with `a.sol` also in that dir

author: leonardoalt
content: and have `eld` in your PATH

author: leonardoalt
content: it should do the whole thing using Eldarica

author: leonardoalt
content:
which you can get here: https://github.com/uuverifiers/eldarica/
(i usually just download the latest nightly)

author: leonardoalt
content:
the JSON input spec is here:
https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/v0.8.11/using-the-compiler.html#compiler-input-and-output-json-description

author: leonardoalt
content: from that point you can also just change the JSON input to bigger contracts, change model checker options, eldarica options, etc etc

author: leonardoalt
content: that solc-js branch is a bit of a mess but makes it a lot easier to run Eldarica

author: leonardoalt
content: hopefully it will get into master soon
